slides.title: Introduction to Syllogism
slides.content:
**Syllogism:** Drawing logical conclusions from given statements

**Structure:**
- Premise 1 (Statement 1)
- Premise 2 (Statement 2)
- Conclusion

**Example:**
All cats are animals.
All animals need food.
Conclusion: All cats need food.

slides.title: Types of Statements
slides.content:
**Universal Positive (A):**
All A are B

**Universal Negative (E):**
No A are B

**Particular Positive (I):**
Some A are B

**Particular Negative (O):**
Some A are not B

slides.title: Rules for Valid Conclusions
slides.content:
**Rule 1:** Two negative premises → No conclusion

**Rule 2:** Two particular premises → No universal conclusion

**Rule 3:** If one premise is negative → Conclusion must be negative

**Rule 4:** If one premise is particular → Conclusion must be particular

slides.title: Venn Diagram Method
slides.content:
**Draw circles for each category**

**Example:**
All dogs are animals
Some animals are pets

- Draw circle for dogs inside animals
- Overlap animals with pets partially

**Conclusion:** Some dogs may be pets (possible but not definite)
